meanings.definition: To deprive of possession or occupancy
meanings.sent1: The landlord tried to disseise the tenant by changing the locks.
meanings.sent2: The government can disseise individuals from their homes for public projects.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf decided to disseise the gnomes from their tiny houses for a prank.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disseise the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell appeared to disseise the rabbit from its hat in a blink of an eye.

meanings.definition: To dispossess or evict from property
meanings.sent1: The court order allowed the landlord to disseise the troublesome tenant legally.
meanings.sent2: The bank may disseise homeowners who fail to pay their mortgages.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon managed to disseise the squirrels from their cozy tree hollow.
meanings.sent4: The new road construction will disseise the birds of their nesting grounds.
meanings.sent5: The giant's footsteps seemed to disseise the tiny creatures from their hiding spots.
